title: Ping Issue (HELP)
body:
So I have been getting the same ping (28ms) for 3 years now and I have had no problems with lag at all. Now all of sudden today I get a steady 94 ping. It is super delayed and its not fun to play with at all. I have the same ping on all other games I play but on League i get a steady 94 ping. I know it's not on my end because it only started happening today and I restarted my router/pc. Like I said, I've been getting the same steady ping for 3-4 years and now all of sudden today I get a steady 94 ping. (ITS ONLY ON LEAGUE OF LEGENDS). I really want it back to normals so I can play with no issues..

ISP: At&t, Indiana

Sincerely,
Phil


UPDATE: ITS FIXED OMG YES! I JUST WENT INTO GAME AND I HAVE MY 30 PING BACK :D

replies.body:
Hey fam,

Thanks for the continued reports and traceroutes.  There is currently an issue with ATT that may be causing an increase in ping for some players.  I don't have any information to share currently, but I'll share updates if they come my way!

I am on Verizon Fios and I have been having the same issues with ping, so it's not just ATT. My ping has taken a liking to staying at a steady 27 ms and then shooting up to anywhere from 150- 400, sometimes even up to 600. The game is unplayable, and I have done the troubleshooter more times than I can count, even going as far as to reinstall windows with no luck. ISP is good, and I can also play any other game flawlessly.

Having similar symptoms doesn't mean that the cause is the same.  League is always online, so connection issues are very common.  You could be having local or other issues reaching our game servers, regardless of how good your ISP is.  I suggest starting off by going over each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure that your network is able to steadily hold comms to the game server.  I hope that helps!

Thanks for getting back to me. As I mentioned, I have gone over the connection issues guide at least 4 times and I've run the hextec repair tool at least the same amount of times. I'm at a loss. I've been browsing these forums forever now in hopes I could find something to save me from not be able to play anymore.

In that case go ahead and hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our  teach team can help you with your case individually.  You'll want to download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) which will give you some context logs to attach to the ticket.  We'll get back to you!

Porocles, thank you for your continuous help. I don't think we as at&t users can do much about this situation but I hope at&t can fix it. Please keep updating us about this being fixed or what not because a lot of league players use AT&T and it's basically unplayable in my opinion. Thanks for helping Porocles <3. 

Sincerely,
Phil

Thank goodness I use mobile hotspot, for ATT and my internet went out this morning at about 3 am.  When it came back 3 minutes later I literally had a 40 increase in my ping. I went from 80 using my hotspot to 120. Please fix this riot.
same issue here, from 34 ping to 94 ping. Have at&t in michigan
Having the same issue. As the days go on I'm seeing more and more threads about this. Hopefully Riot does something.
I am having the same problem, steady 90 ping when it is usually at around 50... Started happening today as well. Restarted router/pc as well. Idk what's up, send help. :c
Yeah It's super delayed and not fun to play on. I think it might be only something with at&t..

I am having the exact same issue. Yesterday at around 9:00 P.M, I randomly dc'd mid game and when I reconnected, I had an astounding 98 ping that wouldn't stagger. Ever since the headquarters move to Chicago, my ping had been at a steady 35.

Posting for visibility.

Ping is usually 17ms, now is 78ms. Wired connection on AT&T with their 1Gbs speeds. Located in Ohio, I understand that this is an ISP issue and not a Riot issue.

What can we, as consumers, do to help AT&T fix the issue?

Having the exact same issue, and I have At&t as well, located in Ohio. My ping has always been 36, but yesterday afternoon my ping went from a 36 to a constant 96. Tried every solution,  my ping is fine outside of game, no packetloss, no high ping in general, nothing. Really need a solution here.
Same problem here. Im with At&T in Illinois. Went from 26 ping to 94 ping

Are you still having this issue?  I was unable to see any issues on NA, but it's possible that your ISP may have had some issue reaching our game server.  Let's get a traceroute to see how your ISP is routing to the game server to see if we can find any hiccups.  Grab [WinMTR ](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and  run a route to 104.160.131.1.  Let me know what you find!

I tried flushing my DNS following those instructions but I still have the same issue. Is my last resort to call my ISP because I don't think it would help. I'm assuming this is only a AT&T ISP issue since it seems that everyone that is having this issue is using AT&T. I don't understand why it just started to happen. If their is any more solutions let me know please..

Thank you,
Philip

I wouldn't recommend contacting your ISP just yet. I do see some other hiccups like your home network spiking up to 139. I suggest first going over that connection guide to rule out possibilities, making sure to go over each step as well as the DNS configuration. Let me know if you have any questions!

I legit went through every single one and have had 0 luck. This is so frustrating.. I've been enjoying league with no issues for years now this is happening and their isn't a fix. Porocles, as I can see by the comments and other posts; it seems to be an issue with AT&T and it's not only me. Is their something you can do on your guys end with AT&T?

Not really.  We don't really have visibility on other ISPs, and we certainly can't tell them what to do.  Hopefully, calling them up may offer some more context on what's going on and why you're being routed the way you have been.  Good luck!

Hi I'm having the same issue. AT&T went from 29 ping to 74.


How should I call AT&T & approach them about this?

As expected flushing the DNS didn't work for me either (considering this is a problem on AT&T's end and not mine/ours). This has to do with the connections AT&T's service decides to use to get you to the league servers so the only thing you can do is complain to them.

I wouldn't recommend contacting your ISP just yet.  I do see some other hiccups like your home network spiking up to 139.  I suggest first going over that connection guide to rule out possibilities, making sure to go over each step as well as the DNS configuration.  Let me know if you have any questions!

Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  homeportal [192.168.1.254] 
  2    19 ms     1 ms     1 ms  104-177-180-1.lightspeed.tukrga.sbcglobal.net [104.177.180.1] 
  3     2 ms     2 ms     2 ms  107.212.168.180 
  4     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  5     6 ms     3 ms     3 ms  12.83.82.165 
  6    62 ms    61 ms    61 ms  12.122.137.233 
  7    65 ms    65 ms    65 ms  206.121.188.14 
  8    65 ms    65 ms    65 ms  104.160.130.44 
  9    65 ms    65 ms    65 ms  ae30-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.12] 
 10    66 ms    76 ms    67 ms  104.160.131.103 
 11    66 ms    66 ms    69 ms  192.64.170.1 

Trace complete.


What should I do. btw I'm so sorry for spamming you

Thanks for this!  Everything looks good as you leave your network, but starts to run into some trouble as soon  the connection hits the ISP.  To be fair, the ping isn't necessarily that bad but if it's higher than what you're used to then it may be worth reaching out to your ISP.  

I suggest starting off with the steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help, specifically the DNS steps to see if you can do some route changes.  

Otherwise, I suggest requesting to speak with a tier 2 agent who can review this log and check out why those nodes are causing an increase.  I hope that helps!
Also having the same issue with ATT, located in Ohio.
Same problem here and I have AT&T too
Run a traceroute as well so we can continue reviewing these specific cases.

please tell me you have tried the most basic solutions like disabling windows defender, and plugging into you modem with an ethernet cable. maybe disable antivirus if you have that active as well. 

i do however know exactly what you are going through and have similar DNS errors. a radical solution is wiping your computer with the refresh tool and reinstalling everything.

i have no clue what ports LoL uses but these solutions might clear up any issues on your side of things.

worthwhile questions:  did you change to the new client or are you still using legacy? does the new client use different ports than the previous?
This issue is happening to everyone that is using at&t. It's not on my end at all.

oops i did not read before i posted again :< im such a noob. 

have you guys seen the 'waht happens when you press Q video'? maybe riot needs to deal specifically with AT&T{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
RIOT!~!~!~! please call AT&T for this. WE ARE ALL HAVING PROBLEMS!

Same issue. ISP AT&T. Central Indiana. Had 18 ms for past year. Today it is 80.

Ran some "ping tests" which say nothing has changed.

Also, I have a Mac. Any tools like WinMTR for Macs? Thanks.

My isp is Optimum, not At&T like everyone else. I'm been experiencing the same issue ever since the new patch. I configured my DNS and I noticed my ping/fps go back to normal where I can play fine, but then a game after that it went back to lagging all over the place.
Same here, on Optimum and have been experiencing the same problems.

> EDIT: I CALLED MY ISP AND THEY SAID THE ISSUE MIGHT BE BECAUSE IM USING WIRELESS INSTEAD OF WIRED. SO IM GOING TO GET WIRED AND SEE IF IT FIXES THE PROBLEM. AT&T DOESNT KNOW WHAT IS CAUSING THIS.

Gang stop wasting your time man. Everybody who isn't at a level 1-2 hours away on a phone is just gonna try to convince you that you're lagging because of your modem or your wifi which isn't the case. Just sit tight and hope AT&T fixes whatever server went down and don't play league until then.

same issue normally sit around 45ms but now its a constant 94

ISP: At&t, oklahoma
same issue as well. tried all the normal stuff.

I just posted this same issue twenty seconds ago and suddenly this popped up.

I'm in the same circumstance Phil. I live in Illinois and my ISP is also AT&T. My friend who lives in the same town is on Comcast and his ping did not have this issue when he was playing an hour before I was.
Yeah It's super delayed and not fun to play on. I think it might be only something with at&t..

It's obviously a problem with AT&T. The question is how long until we can get Riot's attention so they can solve this issue.

I've already sent in a ticket but no response yet. Hopefully Rioteers will be arriving for work seeing it's almost 9am in California.
Bruh 94 is the best I ever get... smh feelsbadman.
AS OF 10:41PM 3/1/2017 IN NA SC, MY PING ISSUE HAS BEEN FIXED THANK YOU RIOT GAMES NA FOR HANDLING THIS!!!
SAME!
